title: Jr Software Engineer
details: Troubleshot and resolved Java code issues in the radio system used by students and instructors, reducing audio delay from 5-7 seconds to less than 1 second. This enhancement enabled real-time communication, significantly improving the effectiveness of the training experience.

Enhanced the behavior of the Windows Desktop application for the instructor station using C# and the .NET framework. The improvements resulted in a seamless viewing experience for instructors, providing a more realistic perspective of the simulation environment from the driver's point of view.
Updated training scenario files to ensure proper placement of obstacles on the ground, creating a highly immersive and dynamic simulation environment.
Identified and resolved issues with vehicle speed data from MATLAB, ensuring an accurate representation of vehicle speed across all scenarios.
Developed PowerShell scripts to validate software installations by generating checksums and comparing the results with the expected values.
Assisted in training the site maintenance team in software installation, troubleshooting, and hardware repair.
Updated site maintenance documentation as required by the on-site team and customers, ensuring up-to-date and comprehensive information for system maintenance.
Traveled to customer locations to deploy, install, and troubleshoot the latest software version, addressing hardware and configuration issues as necessary.

Designed, implemented, and tested a data driven feature using object-oriented design principles, enabling instructors and scenario creators to customize the training course difficulty by controlling the pitch and roll limits of the virtual vehicle.
Created detailed Markdown documentation for easy activation and file creation instructions related to the pitch and roll feature.
Actively participated in team scrum meetings, sprint planning, and sprint retrospectives, fostering collaboration and ensuring smooth project execution.
Collaborated on the development of software that enabled the simulator to seamlessly utilize game engines such as MAK, Unity, or Unreal, enhancing the adaptability of the product.

title: Disney College Program Intern
details: Received a Cast Compliment from a guest for outstanding service, reflecting a commitment to going above and beyond.
Performed multiple tasks and assumed different store positions each shift, demonstrating adaptability and flexibility.
Assisted hundreds of guests on a daily basis, providing product information and answering questions about the WDW property with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Created unforgettable magic moments for guests by ensuring a positive and memorable experience.
